citation.article-title: Marinobacter litoralis sp. nov., a moderately halophilic bacterium isolated from sea water from the East Sea in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Marinobacter litoralis sp. nov.
Marinobacter litoralis (li.to.ra′lis. L. adj. litoralis of the shore).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming rods, 0·5–0·8×1·5–3·0 μm.
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Colonies are cream-coloured, smooth, circular to slightly irregular, low-convex and 1·0–2·0 mm in diameter after 3 days cultivation at 30 °C on MA.
Optimal growth temperature is 30–37 °C.
Grows at 4 and 46 °C, but not above 47 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7·0–8·5; no growth occurs at pH 4·5.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 2–7 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth occurs in the range 0·5–18 % (w/v) NaCl and not in the presence of more than 19 % (w/v) NaCl.
No growth under anaerobic conditions on MA or on MA or synthetic medium with nitrate.
Anaerobic growth does not occur in the absence of nitrate with acetate, citrate, succinate or glucose.
Anaerobic growth does not occur in the presence of nitrate with acetate, citrate, succinate or glucose.
Oxidase- and urease-positive.
Catalase weakly positive.
Tween 80 is hydrolysed, whereas aesculin, casein, gelatin, hypoxanthine, starch, tyrosine and xanthine are not.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.

Acid is not produced from the following sugars: adonitol, l-arabinose, d-cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, d-melezitose, melibiose, myo-inositol, d-raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, d-sorbitol, stachyose, sucrose, d-trehalose and d-xylose.
l-Glutamate and succinate are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources.
Cellobiose, d-fructose, d-glucose, glycerol, d-mannitol, d-mannose, sucrose, d-gluconate, aspartate, dl-alanine, l-arginine and l-serine are not utilized as sole carbon and energy sources.

The following enzymes are present when assayed with the API ZYM test system: alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.

The following enzymes are absent when assayed with the API ZYM system: lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
The major respiratory lipoquinone is Q-9.
The predominant fatty acids are C18 : 1ω9c, C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω9c and C12 : 0 3-OH.
The DNA G+C content is 55 mol% (determined by HPLC).
The type strain, strain SW-45T (=KCCM 41591T =JCM 11547T), was isolated from sea water at Jungdongjin beach on the East Sea in Korea.
